title: 820-2936 One wire ok, no power. Nothing past PP5v_SUS.
message:
Customer board had a blown backlight fuse. Couple weeks later the board is back and not powering on at all.


PPBUS_G3H : 3.325
PP5v_S5: 5.02
PP5v_SUS: 0.431

C7841: 4.89v
R7842: 5.02

C7840::Pin1 5.02v
C7840::Pin2 4.89v

title: 820-2936 One wire ok, no power. Nothing past PP5v_SUS.
message:
PP5V_S5 is created by a chip that is powered by PPBUS_G3H - it steps down PPBUS_G3H's 12.6v to 5v.

PPBUS_G3H is 3.3v on your board. But you say PP5V_S5 is 5v. 

?

title: 820-2936 One wire ok, no power. Nothing past PP5v_SUS.
message:
Sorry, I miss read my notes!

PPBus_G3H is indeed 12.6
PP3v3_S5 is 3.325

I really need to tidy up my notes when I write them down.

title: 820-2936 One wire ok, no power. Nothing past PP5v_SUS.
message:
Pp3v3_s5  is 3.325 volts thats close inuf. 
Keep going. 
First s5 rails partly there. 
Second s3 rails. 
Third s0 rails.

title: 820-2936 One wire ok, no power. Nothing past PP5v_SUS.
message: what you getting on pin 6 U7940 ?

title: 820-2936 One wire ok, no power. Nothing past PP5v_SUS.
820-2936 One wire ok, no power. Nothing past PP5v_SUS.
message: The backlit fuse did not just pop for no reason. This must have been liquid spill. Corrosion under SMC/clock chip?

title: 820-2936 One wire ok, no power. Nothing past PP5v_SUS.
message:
No evidence of liquid, but the board was pretty dusty so may have been humidity.

SMC area looks pretty clean and tidy.

title: 820-2936 One wire ok, no power. Nothing past PP5v_SUS.
message: Backlight fuse still good now? Could be a short in the LCD cable and that could short out BKL to any bus that is connected to the LCD. Check RTC stuff and shorts on all rails.

title: 820-2936 One wire ok, no power. Nothing past PP5v_SUS.
message:
Backlight is OK now.

The system won't boot up and PP5v_SUS is around 0.430v.

title: 820-2936 One wire ok, no power. Nothing past PP5v_SUS.
message:
[USER="2"]dukefawks[/USER] Any suggestions on where to measure from here?

I have a few of boards with missing PP5v_SUS now.

title: 820-2936 One wire ok, no power. Nothing past PP5v_SUS.
820-2936 One wire ok, no power. Nothing past PP5v_SUS.
820-2936 One wire ok, no power. Nothing past PP5v_SUS.
message: 1.5V at DSW is no good. Usually SMC related, I bet there is crap under it.

title: 820-2936 One wire ok, no power. Nothing past PP5v_SUS.
message:
Thanks Duke.
What are my options for sorting out the problem? I seem to get a large amount of SMC issues.
